quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Gerald Ford and John Kennedy
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, leader, uzbekistan. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Gerald Ford played football for the team of what university?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Michigan

questions.question: In 2007 this person was the de facto ruler of Saudi Arabia since 1995, king since 2005 and the ruler of the world’s largest oil reserves.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: King Abdullah

questions.question: Gerald Ford was a Lt. Commander in the Navy.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: This person began his rule of Uzbekistan in 1989.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Islam Karimov

questions.question: This US Senator was born above a drug store in Wallace, SD.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Hubert H. Humphrey of Minnesota

questions.question: Gerald Ford had four children.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: What political distinction does former President Gerald Ford hold?

options.text: The youngest president to hold office
The first president to visit a foreign country
The first  president to be appointed (not elected) to the offices of VP and President.
The only president to hold the offices of VP and President.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The first  president to be appointed (not elected) to the offices of VP and President.

questions.question: Which US Senator, while in a Vice Presidential Debate, stated:  I knew John Kennedy, John Kennedy was a friend of mine and, Senator, you are no John Kennedy.?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Lloyd Bentsen of Texas

questions.question: This US Senator of the 60-80s was known as Senator Wheat for his skill at raising wheat subsidies.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Milton Young of North Dakota

questions.question: Which leader took control of Equatorial Guinea in 1979?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Teodoro Obian Nguema

questions.question: Richard Cheney was appointed by Gerald Ford as Chief of Staff.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Gerald Ford was the first U.S. President to live past the age of 90.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: From 1965 to 1973 Gerald Ford served as House Minority Leader.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: When did Gerald Ford take the oath of office?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: August 1974

questions.question: Which was the leader of Myanmar in 2007?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Than Shwe

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Senator and State
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, actor, john. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: How many perfect scores did Nadia Comaneci receive in the 1976 Montreal Olympics?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 7

questions.question: In 2006, this state reelected one of their liberal US Senators while continuing to maintain a Republican governorship and legislature.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: North Dakota

questions.question: George Washington was elected by Congress and not by the Electoral College of the United States.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: This Senator from Maine, who ran for President in 1972, bowed out when reporters questioned him about his wifes health and tears were shed.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Edmund Muskie

questions.question: The assassination of what political figure essentially brought on World War I?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Archduke Franz Ferdinand of Austria

questions.question: Whom was Mary Ann Todd married to?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Abraham Lincoln

questions.question: What late actor (April 3, 1924 – July 1, 2004), born in Omaha, made his home in Tahiti?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Marlon Brando

questions.question: This Senator from Illinois, who also ran for President, was fond of bow ties.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Paul Simon

questions.question: 3rd century astronomer Aristarchus of Samos was ahead of his time in suggesting what?

options.text: That the earth revolves around its axis
That the earth revolves around the sun

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: That the earth revolves around the sun

questions.question: In 1687, what English scientist published Philosophiae Naturalis Principia Mathematica, which described the universal laws of mechanics?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Sir Isaac Newton

questions.question: In what town and state was J. F. Kennedy born?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Brookline, MA

questions.question: Which US Senator, and later Vice President, was nicknamed Fritz?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Walter Mondale of Minnesota

questions.question: This Senator appeared in the Civil War movie Gods and Generals in 2003 along with Senator George Allen of Virginia, as a Confederate officer.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Robert Byrd

questions.question: Which senator from Kansas was Gerald Fords vice presidential candidate in 1976?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Robert Dole

questions.question: Which SD Senator was defeated by John Thune in 2004 in his bid for re-election?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Tom Daschle

quizzes.title: Science Quiz: Love and Children
quizzes.description: Test your science knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Science, fiction, people. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: One of the children of Louisa Catherine Adams, First Lady from 1825 to 1829, was the victim of a kidnapping.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Love is the only force capable of transforming an enemy into friend. is an inspirational quote by American activist Martin Luther King, Jr.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: The controversial American photographer Diane Arbus defined love as a peculiar unfathomable combination of understanding and ______________.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: misunderstanding

questions.question: According to the Bible, whom did King David speak his last words to?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Solomon

questions.question: How on earth are you ever going to explain in terms of chemistry and physics so important a biological phenomenon as first love? exclaimed which great scientist of the 20th century?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Albert Einstein

questions.question: Martha Jefferson, wife of President Thomas Jefferson, gave birth to two children.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: Fill in the missing word to get a quote on love by the great missionary Mother Teresa: If you _____ people, you have no time to love them.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: judge

questions.question: Which science fiction author made this connection between love and the universe: If the universe has any purpose more important then topping a woman you love and making a baby with her hearty help, I have never heard of it.?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Robert A. Heinlein

questions.question: Which French author made the following conclusion about the presence of love:” No disguise can long conceal love where it is, nor feign it where it is not.”?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: François de La Rochefoucauld

questions.question: Which philosopher concluded Love is composed of a single soul inhabiting two bodies.?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Aristotle

questions.question: Which was the first NBA basketball team to sign a female player?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Indiana Pacers

questions.question: Which great scientist said the following humorous statement about love: “Gravitation cannot be held responsible for people falling in love.“?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Albert Einstein

questions.question: “He felt now that he was not simply close to her, but that he did not know where he ended and she began.” is an excerpt from a novel by which great 19-century writer?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Leo Tolstoy

questions.question: Elizabeth Monroe, First Lady from 1817 to 1825, had a child who died from whooping cough.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Which American musician does this statement belong to: When the power of love overcomes the love of power, the world will know peace.?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Jimi Hendrix

quizzes.title: Knowledge Quiz: Lady and Following
quizzes.description: Test your knowledge knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Knowledge, bush, people. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Letitia Christian Tyler, who was First Lady from 1841 to 1842, so disdained the great unwashed that she would not participate in public affairs.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: How many US states contain the New adjective in their names?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 4

questions.question: One U.S. First Lady wrote an autobiography entitled Adventures of a Nobody.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Louisa Catherine Adams, First Lady from 1825 to 1829, had only three pregnancies.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: New Zealand was named after which of the following?

options.text: Zealandia (a submerged continent that sank after breaking from Antarctica some 70 million years ago)

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Zeeland (a province in Holland)

questions.question: What is New South Wales?

options.text: a UK overseas territory on the Pacific Ocean

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: a state in Australia

questions.question: New York City was originally established as which other New city?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: New Amsterdam

questions.question: Which first lady single-handedly protected her husband from contact with the public after he suffered a stroke?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Edith Bolling Wilson

questions.question: Which US state is part of New England?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Rhode Island

questions.question: Elizabeth Monroe, First Lady from 1817 to 1875, never had health problems.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: Which First Lady lost a son as a result of a train accident?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Jane Pierce

questions.question: Barbara Bush, First Lady from 1989 to 1993, gave birth to six children.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Which of these is the correct official name of a Canadian province?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Nova Scotia

questions.question: New Brunswick was named in honor of whom/what?

options.text: HMS Brunswick, a ship of the British Royal Navy
King George III of the House of Brunswick
A town in English West Midlands
Brunswick Corporation, an American manufacturing company

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: King George III of the House of Brunswick

questions.question: New Orleans is a city in southern US. Where is Orleans located?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: France

quizzes.title: Sports Quiz: Names and Jock
quizzes.description: Test your sports knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Sports, rookie, athlete. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What member of the rock band KISS dated Cher after she separated with Gregg Allman?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Gene Simmons

questions.question: Which one of the prominent Reds listed below had the given first and middle names Arnold Jacob?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Auerbach

questions.question: Which of the hoop stars below played with his actual name?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Cazzie Russell

questions.question: The original first and middle names of former Orioles first baseman Boog Powell are the same as the names of which historic religious figure?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: John Wesley

questions.question: Who revolutionized medical surgery by introducing sterilization?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Joseph Lister

questions.question: The Rookie Jock-Name of the Year award should go to Minnesota Twins pitcher Boof Bonser, especially because its his real name, too.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: This Yankee shortstops clutch home run made a real dent in the Red Sox in the 1978 playoffs. His given name is Russell Earl. What is his jock name?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bucky

questions.question: Which present day territory was NOT part of Nueva España (New Spain)?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Peru

questions.question: Denton True Young is the true birth name of this pioneer pitcher, whose name graces baseballs premier annual pitching award (the Cy Young Award). But how did he acquire the nickname Cy?

options.text: Its short for Seymour, his mothers name.
He would sigh audibly on the rare occasions when he walked a batter.
Its short for Cyclops, the fearsome, one-eyed monster.
Its short for cyclone, because of the power of his fastball.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Its short for cyclone, because of the power of his fastball.

questions.question: Born with the first and middle names Jacobus Franciscus, this legendary athlete is the first American sports figure to ever have a small town named after him.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Jim Thorpe

questions.question: Which of the following athletes has the jock name closest to his real name?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Champ Bailey

questions.question: According to the Bible, Nebuchadrezzar I was king of what?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Babylon

questions.question: What are the last names of the top-flight golfers, nicknamed Fuzzy and Chi Chi?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Rodriquez and Zoeller

questions.question: Oakland Athletics slugger Milton Bradley has been tagged with which of the following jock names?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: None of these

questions.question: What US President was shot and later passed away only four months after his inauguration?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: James A. Garfield

quizzes.title: Knowledge Quiz: William and Normandy
quizzes.description: Test your knowledge knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Knowledge, confessor, people. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Who was King of England 1042 to 1066.  This King is the King from
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Edward the Confessor

questions.question: William of Normandy lived during what  period of time?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1028 to 1087

questions.question: William, Duke of Normandy, married whom?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Matilda of Flanders

questions.question: Where did William, (later to become William the Conqueror) reside prior to the Norman Conquest?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: France

questions.question: Edward the Confessor of England tried to gain support from William, Duke of Normandy, prior to the Norman Conquest.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: How many English Kings bore the name William?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Four

questions.question: In 1985, who broke Ty Cobbs major league record for career hits?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Pete Rose

questions.question: William, Duke of Normandy, was crowned King of England on December 25, 1066.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: What is the name of the decisive battle of the Conquest of Normandy?

options.text: Battle for the Throne of England

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Battle of Hastings

questions.question: What was the first name of Richard Chamberlain?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: George

questions.question: To what comedy team did Graham Chapman belong?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Monty Python

questions.question: Who was the first US Vice President to die in office?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: George Clinton

questions.question: By which king was William of Normandy knighted?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The King of France

questions.question: William I, King of England, William the Conqueror, is responsible for all the following except which one?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Church of England

questions.question: Who was Sergey Korolyovs western rival?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Wernher von Braun
